programme.title: ACC Football Championship
programme.desc: Clemson (10-2) vs. North Carolina (9-3) for the ACC title in Charlotte, N.C. From Bank of America Stadium. Freshman QB Drake Maye (41 overall TDs, 5 INTs) and UNC are 6-0 away from home entering this clash of teams coming off disappointing home losses. Sophomore RB Will Shipley powers the Tigers' bid for their seventh ACC title in eight years.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: The Red Bandana has become a symbol of bravery and sacrifice on the Boston College campus thanks to alumnus Welles Crowther, who died on 9/11 in the South Tower of the World Trade Center and was identified by those he saved by his red bandana. The Eagles football team dons uniforms for one game each year dedicated to his memory, generating a spirit of unity on the campus and some Red Bandana Game magic between the lines.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: It's "The Most Exciting 25 Seconds in Football" when the Clemson Tigers enter Memorial Stadium gathering around the iconic symbol, "Howard's Rock," before they "run down the hill" at Death Valley to an explosion of cheers from more than 80,000 fans.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: A burning spear thrown into the turf at midfield begins every Florida State game at Doak Campbell Stadium, where 80,000 Seminole fans do the "Tomahawk Chop" as Chief Osceola, on his horse Renegade, pumps up the 'Noles crowd.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: Virginia Tech's Corp of Cadets fire a cannon after each Hokies score at Lane Stadium in Blacksburg. "Skipper" the cannon, (named for JFK) has been a tradition for almost 55 years, created just for Tech's rivalry with nearby VMI, who had their own cannon.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: A 1930 Ford Model A leads the Georgia Tech football team out of every game at Bobby Dodd Stadium. The "Ramblin' Wreck" is one of the most time-honored traditions in the nation as Yellow Jacket fans cheer the Sports Coupe and the team onto the field.

programme.title: ACC Traditions
programme.desc: For most of Mike Krzyzewski's long tenure at Duke, "Krzyzewskiville" has been the student hot spot as they reside, study and eat in tents for weeks just to be one of the "Cameron Crazies" for Blue Devils home games.

programme.title: Zombie House Flipping
programme.desc: A probate house becomes available to the Zombie team. Their initial walkthrough reveals the makings of a sweet party pad.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A woman is almost crushed by a car outside a bar in Oregon after confronting an alleged thief; A family in Colorado is cut off by a motorcycle gang on their way to a picnic; A man strips in a parking lot in California; A man gets his car totaled after trying to pass a truck in Upstate New York.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.sub-title: Do You Know Who I Am?

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Drinks are thrown, fists fly, and a car is rammed during an argument at a Houston intersection. Meanwhile, a lane change miscalculation turns into a nightmare when a semi-truck rolls over on a highway in Macon, Georgia.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A man in Texas is pursued by an angry driver wielding a finger gun. A driver raging at two women in California is intercepted by two men who send him packing. A rideshare driver in Texas has food thrown in her face by an unruly passenger. A motorcyclist in Virginia Beach attempts to talk his way out of a baseball bat beatdown after a close call with a pedestrian.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A distracted police officer in Missouri strikes a bicyclist with his vehicle. A woman is caught red-handed keying another person's car in Louisiana. A motorcyclist crashes into a ditch after being sideswiped by a jeep in Illinois. And a man in California appears to flee the scene of an accident, until he realizes the man he hit has his license plate number.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A disagreement over driving rules at a parking lot in Washington ends with multiple gunshots.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A motorcyclist in Colorado keeps his cool during a heated argument until the other driver touches his bike. A valet's joyride in Miami goes up in smoke. An erratic driver crashes their way down an interstate in New Jersey. A mother and her toddler are knocked off a motorbike into oncoming traffic in Vietnam.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: Two men attempt a carjacking at a Louisiana car wash. A hapless teenage driver turns an Alabama parking lot into a demolition derby. A reckless driver in an SUV hits a biker and car with a baby on a Texas Highway. And it's a tiny kitten versus rush hour traffic in Oklahoma.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: A raging back and forth between three vehicles on a California highway ends with a man being rammed head-on by a truck. Carjackers relentlessly pursue a terrified driver in Albuquerque. An angry motorcyclist confronts a driver in Massachusetts, and is met with a baseball bat. People are caught asleep at the wheel in self-driving cars.

programme.title: Road Wars
programme.desc: The dump truck driver in Olympia, Washington, faces a man who takes offense to the truck's exhaust.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: A customer fights a raging fire in a New Jersey superstore. Then, a mother in Massachusetts calls 911 on her son's barber, and late-night brawlers in Maryland end up crashing through a store's window.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: A shoplifter takes on a security guard in Oregon. A brawl breaks out in a parking lot in Illinois as thousands of concert-goers try to leave at once. An emergency room doctor's horrific bedside manner is caught on camera in California. A couple's dream vacation turns into a nightmare when they discover their hotel room in New York City is infested with bed bugs.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: One customer's kind gesture sparks an all-out brawl in a Florida convenience store. Meanwhile, cops are called after shoppers duke it out over toilet paper, and a retired police officer in California blocks an alleged shoplifter from leaving the parking lot.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: A woman vandalizes a New Jersey convenience store; a rideshare driver in Florida is pushed to the brink by a rude rider; a police officer uses his taser to neutralize a knife-wielding woman at a superstore in Florida; and a grandmother in Canada thwarts the plans of a masked shoplifter.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: A man in Florida attacks a fast food cashier apparently over a lack of available straws; a grounded passenger in Texas gets a serious comeuppance after slapping an airline employee, and a man in a grocery store beats the manager with sausage allegedly for not allowing him to purchase beer.

programme.title: Customer Wars
programme.desc: A woman in Idaho tries to steal a chainsaw by stuffing it in her pants. Disgusted customers watch a woman eat directly from the serving ladle at a restaurant buffet. A teenager attempting to get his hands on some alcohol struggles to outrun security in California. A brawl over a cell phone spills across the bleachers at a Nashville football game.

programme.title: Fred Claus
programme.desc: Santa's ne'er-do-well older brother wreaks havoc on the holidays when he is forced to work at the North Pole's toy shop to pay off a debt. Vince Vaughn and Paul Giamatti star in this hilarious and heartwarming family comedy. John Michael Higgins, Miranda Richardson, Rachel Weisz, Kathy Bates. Directed by David Dobkin.

programme.title: Christmas With the Kranks
programme.desc: Tim Allen ("The Santa Clause") and Jamie Lee Curtis star in this charming Yuletide comedy. When their daughter goes away for the holidays, the Kranks (Allen and Curtis) decide to skip Christmas---much to the chagrin of their holiday-loving neighbors. But the Kranks must desperately scramble to create a festive holiday after their child announces she's coming home after all.

programme.title: Four Christmases
programme.desc: When their annual vacation getaway falls through, a happily unmarried couple are forced to spend Christmas with the families of their four divorced parents on the same day. Reese Witherspoon and Vince Vaughn star in this warm and hilarious holiday tale. Robert Duvall, Jon Favreau, Mary Steenburgen, Dwight Yoakam. Directed by Seth Gordon.

programme.title: Elf
programme.desc: Will Ferrell is utterly charming in this amiable holiday fantasy. He plays Buddy, an overgrown and inept human who was raised by Santa's helpers. He decides to search for his birth father, a publisher in New York City.

programme.title: National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation
programme.desc: A family host their dysfunctional relatives for the holiday as the dad contends with spontaneously combusting Christmas lights and temperamental trees while anticipating the arrival of his annual bonus.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.sub-title: We Fish You a Merry Christmas
programme.desc: Australian singer Alli Simpson helps Wayde and Brett spread holiday cheer when they make a surprise aquarium donation to Hurley Children's Hospital in Flint, Mich.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Comedian Gabriel Iglesias requests a tank inspired by his fascination with Volkswagen buses for his remodeled office, but the job is interrupted by a robbery at ATM's headquarters.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: DJ Steve Aoki wants an aquarium that features a three-headed dragon about to escape from the tank.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Basketball player Dwight Howard returns. He needs the crew at ATM to design and build a habitat for all 14 of his snakes.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Filmmaker Kevin Smith has two turtles and one tortoise that need a new home, but they require two different living environments.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Alyssa Milano requests a tank for her family that has a built-in wine rack.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Hip-hop artist Ty Dolla $ign wants a large freshwater tank for his house in Long Beach that has a real rock insert and replicas of his awards, all embedded in a wall.

programme.title: Tanked
programme.desc: Wayde and Brett compete for bragging rights to see who can build the baddest tank, and the contest is judged by "Jackass" cocreator Jeff Tremaine.

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: The final chapter of the Twelfth Doctor's journey sees the Time Lord team up with the first ever Doctor and a returning Bill Potts for one last adventure.

programme.title: Happy Feet
programme.desc: This tap-happy winner of the Best Animated Feature Film Oscar is about a musical penguin colony that finds its mates through song, and Mumble, an outcast who can't carry a tune but can dance like Fred Astaire. Rich with magnificent choreography, breathtaking Antarctic vistas and a catchy, peppy soundtrack.

programme.title: Charlie and the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Tim Burton ("Edward Scissorhands") directed this wonderfully whimsical fantasy. A poor boy (Freddie Highmore) and four bratty children win a tour of a mysterious chocolate factory. Their personal guide is the owner, an eccentric candy man (Johnny Depp) named Willy Wonka. The film is based on Roald Dahl's classic children's tale and is a remake of 1971's "Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory."

programme.title: Willy Wonka & the Chocolate Factory
programme.desc: Five children from around the world win golden tickets to tour the mysterious candy factory, where they meet the manufacturer and learn life lessons about honesty, punishment and reward.

programme.title: RIVALS: Ohio State vs. Michigan
programme.desc: Documenting the storied Ohio State-Michigan college football rivalry. Interviews include former players Archie Griffin, Dan Dierdorf and Keith Byars, plus Rich Eisen, Joel Klatt and historians Jack Park and John Bacon. Narrated by JK Simmons and created in collaboration with Jon L. Wertheim.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2021: Ohio State (10-1) at Michigan (10-1). From Michigan Stadium. Frosh QB C.J. Stroud pilots the top-ranked Buckeyes offense (559 ypg) against LB Josh Ross and a UM defense allowing just 16.3 ppg. The Wolverines' only win in the last 16 meetings was in 2011.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Michigan (11-0) at Ohio State (11-0). From Ohio Stadium. It's the first time since 2006 that these bitter rivals meet while both undefeated, with a Big Ten title shot on the line. The Wolverines won 42-27 last year to snap an eight-game series slide.

programme.title: The B1G Moment
programme.desc: Hear from Desmond Howard, his brother Jonathan, Marc Jacobson and Ohio State's Tim Williams as they look back at the events that led up to Howard's iconic touchdown run and Heisman pose in the end zone.

programme.title: Classic College Football
programme.desc: From 2011: Illinois vs. UCLA in the Kraft Fight Hunger Bowl. The Illini won 20-14, with QB Nathan Scheelhaase rushing for 110 yards, and the Illini defense holding UCLA to 18 yards rushing.

programme.title: The Journey: Big Ten Football

Vance, Gregory Hines, Justin Pierre Edmund, Jenifer Lewis, Loretta Devine, Lionel Richie.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Once a Southern institution, barbecue has become an American obsession. In that transformation, Texas brisket got mainstreamed. This is a story about a scrappy one-time oil boomtown, where cooks make the most of scraps and the oppressiveness of brisket, and how popular narratives have obscured two Gulf Coast dishes that manage to hang on.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Exploring the small town of Brownsville, Tenn., which is home to Helen's Bar-B-Que and City Fish Market. Also, the Mindfield and Master Barber Shop Menagerie Museum are explored.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Exploring Bowman, S.C., the birthplace and burial place of Mary Beverly Evans Edge, mother of host John T. Edge. On the Edisto River, at a fish camp like the one her father built, Edge reconnects with his family's roots and face down his mother's complicated legacy over liver pudding with grits and catfish stew with rice.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: An in-depth look at life at the buckle on the Boudin Belt in Cajun Country. We meet Robert Cormier of the Best Stop and Logan Kartchner of Kartchner's Specialty Meats. We learn from Donald Link, the Cajun Country-born chef, and Barry Jean Ancelet, the professor and poet who helped lead that renaissance. We dance to musical performances by K.C. Jones, and Lil Nathan & the Zydeco Big Timers.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Lake Chicot is the largest oxbow in North America. We explore how the river has shaped Lake Village and its people. At Cowboy's Steakhouse, Santa Lee cooks prime ribeyes in the rear of a chain pizza restaurant. At Rhoda's Famous Hot Tamales and Pies, Rhoda Adams and her daughter bake half-pecan and half-sweet potato pies worth a three-hour drive.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Discovering one of the most diverse ecosystems on three boats in the Gulf of Mexico. John visits two Mobile Bay staples: Pirate's Cove and Cozy Brown's.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: We travel to the city on the cusp of the South to try everything St. Louis from their Italian hot salami sandwiches to an American cheeseburger cooked on a 1936 vintage grill.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: The bus is making stops all along the Mississippi River as they check out the sites from New Orleans to Greenville, Miss. to Memphis.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: TrueSouth drives the rolling back roads of southern Kentucky, to gnaw pork shoulder steaks cooked over hickory fires and eat burgers fried in shallow oil. We introduce viewers to a cultural microclimate that straddles the Kentucky-Tennessee line, where old traditions thrive and grown men gather in the Monroe County Marble Club Super Dome to play serious games of great skill that are compelling to watch and complex to score.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Our crew goes home with Allan Benton, proprietor of Benton's Smoky Mountain Country Hams, to get to know his wife Sharon and their children and grandchildren. We learn to bake biscuits with Sharon (and yes, we include her recipe). And to stir up a good gravy. More important, gathered in their kitchen, we get to witness the love and hard work that binds a man and a woman to their family, and their community.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: A visit to Jackson, Miss., to witness the drive and hustle and belief that a creative class of risk takers and change makers now brings to bear in this capital city. Jackson faced down a summer crisis that left the city without safe water for six weeks, but those problems do not define this city. Instead, we celebrate the work of artists and musicians and chefs whose commitment to excellence make Jackson a magnet for Mississippians who regard creativity as an engine for progress.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Tommy Tomlinson, author of The Elephant in the Room, returns to Brunswick and St. Simons Island, Ga., where he grew up. Tommy joins the TrueSouth crew to walk the beach, play pinball, take in a baseball game, and reacquaint himself with the foods of his youth. Those foods represent family and pleasure for Tommy. Because he's fighting to control his weight, they also represent a kind of peril.

programme.title: TrueSouth
programme.desc: Spotlighting the food and culture of the southeastern U.S., exploring cherished local eateries while getting to know the people of the "beautiful-yet-complex South."

Despite protests from his mother that he'll shoot his eye out, Ralphie persists, unsuccessfully trying to enlist the assistance of both his teacher and Santa Claus. All the while, Ralphie finds himself dealing with the constant taunts of a pair of bullies and trying to not get in the middle of a feud between his mother and father regarding a certain lamp.
